shellous.doc: shellous provides a concise API for running subprocesses.

shellous.command.doc:
Implements the Context and Command classes.

  • A Context creates new command objects.
  • A Command specifies the arguments and options used to run a program.

shellous.command.Options.inherit_env.doc: True if subprocess should inherit the current environment variables.

shellous.command.Options.input_close.doc: True if input object should be closed after subprocess launch.

shellous.command.Options.output_append.doc: True if output object should be opened in append mode.

shellous.command.Options.output_close.doc: True if output object should be closed after subprocess launch.

shellous.command.Options.error_append.doc: True if error object should be opened in append mode.

shellous.command.Options.error_close.doc: True if error object should be closed after subprocess launch.

shellous.command.Options.encoding.doc: Specifies encoding of input/ouput. None means binary.

shellous.command.Options.return_result.doc: True if we should return Result object instead of the output text/bytes.

shellous.command.Options.incomplete_resu.doc: True if we should raise ResultError after clean up from cancelled task.

shellous.command.Options.exit_codes.doc: Set of exit codes that do not raise a ResultError. None means {0}.

shellous.command.Options.cancel_timeout.doc: Timeout in seconds that we wait for a cancelled process to terminate.

shellous.command.Options.cancel_signal.doc: The signal sent to terminate a cancelled process.

shellous.command.Options.alt_name.doc: Alternate name for the command to use when logging.

shellous.command.Options.merge_env.doc: Return our env merged with the global environment.

shellous.command.Options.set.doc: Return new options with given properties updated.

shellous.command.Context.doc: Concrete class for an immutable execution context.

shellous.command.Context.set.doc: Return new context with custom options set.

shellous.command.Command.doc:
A Command instance is lightweight and immutable object that specifies the arguments and options used to run a program. Commands do not do anything until they are awaited.

Commands are always created by a Context.

# Create a context.
sh = shellous.context()

# Create a new command from the context.
echo = sh("echo", "hello, world")

# Run the command.
result = await echo

shellous.command.Command.name.doc:
Returns the name of the program being run.

Names longer than 31 characters are truncated. If alt_name option is set, return that instead.

shellous.command.Command.multiple_captur.doc: Return true if the stdin is set to CAPTURE or more than one of stdout, stderr is set to CAPTURE.

shellous.command.Command.set.doc:
Return new command with custom options set.

  • Set inherit_env to False to prevent the command from inheriting the parent environment.
  • Set encoding to a string encoding like "utf-8", or "utf-8 replace". If encoding is None, use raw bytes.
  • Set return_result to True to return a Result object instead of the standard output. The Result object includes the exit code.
  • Set incomplete_result to True to return a ResultError object when the command is cancelled, instead of a CancelledError.
  • Set exit_codes to the set of allowed exit codes that will not raise a ResultError. None means {0}.
  • Set cancel_timeout to the timeout in seconds to wait for a process to terminate after sending it the cancel signal.
  • Set cancel_signal to the signal used to stop a process when it is cancelled.
  • Set alt_name to an alternative name of the command to be displayed in logs. Used to resolve ambiguity when the actual command name is a scripting language.

shellous.command.Command.task.doc: Wrap the command in a new asyncio task.

shellous.command.Command.run.doc:
Return a Runner to run the process incrementally.

async with cmd.run() as run:
    # do something with run.stdin, run.stdout, run.stderr...
    # close run.stdin to signal we're done...
result = run.result()

shellous.harvest.harvest.doc:
Run a bunch of awaitables as tasks. Do not return results.

After the harvest returns, all of the awaitables are guaranteed to be done.

Raises first exception seen, or just returns normally.

Similar to asyncio.gather but doesn't return anything. If an awaitable raises an exception, the other awaitables are immediately cancelled and consumed before raising the first exception seen.

Set timeout to specify a timeout in seconds. When the timeout expires, all awaitables are cancelled and consumed before raising a asyncio.TimeoutError.

If harvest is cancelled itself, all awaitables are cancelled and consumed before raising CancelledError.

shellous.harvest.harvest_results.doc:
Run a bunch of awaitables as tasks and return (cancelled, results).

cancelled, results = harvest_results(aws)

After the harvest returns, all of the awaitables are guaranteed to be done.

Exceptions are included in the result list, including CancelledError.

Similar to asyncio.gather with return_exceptions with one difference: If an awaitable raises an exception, the other awaitables are immediately cancelled and consumed before returning any results.

Set timeout to specify a timeout in seconds. When the timeout expires, all awaitables are cancelled and consumed before raising a asyncio.TimeoutError.

If harvest_results is cancelled itself, all awaitables are cancelled and cancelled is returned as True.

shellous.harvest.harvest_wait.doc:
Wait for tasks to finish or raise an exception.

After the harvest returns, all of the tasks are guaranteed to be done.

If there are pending tasks, they are cancelled and collected. Their exceptions are not consumed.

Set timeout to specify a timeout in seconds. When the timeout expires, all tasks are cancelled and consumed before raising a asyncio.TimeoutError.

If harvest_wait is cancelled itself, all tasks are cancelled and consumed before raising CancelledError.

shellous.log.log_method.doc:
log_method logs when an async method call is entered and exited.

stepin stepout

If _info is True, include platform info in log message.

Use kwds to log other arguments.

shellous.pipeline.Pipeline.doc: A Pipeline is a sequence of commands.

shellous.pipeline.Pipeline.multiple_capt.doc: Return true if pipe uses multiple capture.

shellous.pipeline.Pipeline.stdin.doc: Set stdin on the first command of the pipeline.

shellous.pipeline.Pipeline.stdout.doc: Set stdout on the last command of the pipeline.

shellous.pipeline.Pipeline.task.doc: Wrap the command in a new asyncio task.

shellous.pipeline.Pipeline.run.doc:
Return a Runner to help run the pipeline incrementally.

async with pipe.run() as run:
    # do something with run.stdin, run.stdout, run.stderr...
    # close stdin to signal we're done...
result = run.result()

shellous.redirect.doc: Implements the Redirect enum and various redirection utilities.

shellous.redirect.Redirect.is_custom.doc: Return true if this redirect option is not built into asyncio.

shellous.redirect.copy_stringio.doc: Copy bytes from source stream to dest StringIO.

shellous.redirect.copy_bytesio.doc: Copy bytes from source stream to dest BytesIO.

shellous.redirect.copy_bytearray.doc: Copy bytes from source stream to dest bytearray.

shellous.result.Result.doc: Concrete class for the result of a Command.

shellous.result.PipeResult.doc: Concrete class for the result of command that is part of a Pipe.

shellous.result.make_result.doc:
Convert list of results into a single pipe result.

result can be a list of Result, ResultError or another Exception.

shellous.runner.Runner.doc:
Runner is an asynchronous context manager that runs a command.

async with cmd.run() as run:
    # process run.stdin, run.stdout, run.stderr (if not None)
result = run.result()

shellous.runner.Runner.result.doc: Check process exit code and raise a ResultError if necessary.

shellous.runner.PipeRunner.doc:
PipeRunner is an asynchronous context manager that runs a pipeline.

async with pipe.run() as run:
    # process run.stdin, run.stdout, run.stderr (if not None)
result = run.result()

shellous.runner.PipeRunner.__init__.doc: capturing=True indicates we are within an async with block and client needs to access stdin and stderr streams.

shellous.util.decode.doc: Utility function to decode optional byte strings.

shellous.util.coerce_env.doc:
Utility function to coerce environment variables to string.

If the value of an environment variable is ..., grab the value from the parent environment.

shellous.util.close_fds.doc: Close open file descriptors or file objects.
